rocks.bastion.core

Class BastionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • rocks.bastion.core.BastionFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultBastionFactory

    public abstract class BastionFactory
extends Object
    Creates and configures an instance of the BastionBuilderImpl fluent builder. A single factory can be designated as the Default factory which is used by the Bastion.request(String, HttpRequest) method. Subclasses will generally implement the prepareBastion(BastionBuilderImpl) to further configure the instance with any additional features necessary.

        public BastionFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultBastionFactory

        public static BastionFactory getDefaultBastionFactory()
        Gets the BastionFactory which is designated as the "Default" factory. This factory is the one used when a user calls the Bastion.request(String, HttpRequest) method.
        Returns:
        A non-null factory instance which is considered to be the "Default."

      • setDefaultBastionFactory

        public static void setDefaultBastionFactory(BastionFactory defaultBastionFactory)
        Designate a new factory instance as the "Default". This changes which factory is used when users call the Bastion.request(String, HttpRequest) method allowing external systems to modify Bastion functionality. For example, a test library could potentially register a new factory which will register event listeners for when Bastion calls start/end to display them in a UI.
        Parameters:
        defaultBastionFactory - The factory instance to designate as "Default". Cannot be null.

      • getBastion

        public BastionBuilder<String> getBastion(String message,
                                         HttpRequest request)
        Construct and initialise a new instance of the BastionBuilderImpl builder. By default, the returned builder will bind the response to a String model. Also, the returned builder will use the specified message (for informational purposes) and request.
        Parameters:
        message - A non-null String which describes the request/test that Bastion will be performing. This message will typically be used and displayed on a UI or test reports for informational purposes.
        request - A non-null instance of a HttpRequest which will be performed by Bastion.
        Returns:
        A fully configured instance of the BastionBuilderImpl fluent builder which can be used directly by the user to construct Bastion tests.

      • suppressAssertions

        public void suppressAssertions(boolean suppressAssertions)
        Configures whether BastionBuilderImpl objects returned by this factory should be configured to suppress assertions or not. When set to suppress assertions, Bastion will execute the HTTP request as normal as well as any callbacks provided but will skip executing any assertions provided to the BastionBuilderImpl.withAssertions(Assertions) method.
        Parameters:
        suppressAssertions - true to suppress assertions; false, otherwise.

      • prepareBastion

        protected abstract void prepareBastion(BastionBuilderImpl<?> bastion)
        Configures the specified instance of the BastionBuilderImpl builder. Factory subclasses must override this method to configure the builder for use with external systems/libraries. An implementation will typically register event listeners or model converters to be used by Bastion.
        Parameters:
        bastion - The builder instance to configure.
